body.name: Amcrest 5MP IP PoE AI Camera w/ 49ft Color Night Vision, Security Outdoor Bullet Camera, Built-in Microphone, Human & Vehicle Detection, Active Deterrent, 129° FOV, 5MP@20fps IP5M-B1276EB-AI (Black)
features: AI FEATURES & DUAL ILLUMINATION – AI Bullet PoE IP Camera features Human & Vehicle Detection, IVS (Tripwire, Intrusion Detection) which triggers an event anytime a human or vehicle crosses the defined area (prevents false alerts). Dual illumination night vision with Full NightColor warm/white LED & IR-LED nightvision. 5-Megapixel @20fps video with a super-wide 129° viewing angle. PoE injector or switch required; not included, sold separately.

SMARTER SECURITY – Receive motion alert notifications and review footage using your smartphone with the Amcrest View app. Playback and record professionally on a PC using the Amcrest Surveillance Pro software for Windows and MAC or Blue Iris Professional. Works with Amcrest Cloud remote video storage, Amcrest NVRs, Synology and QNAP NAS, SFTP, FTP, and most mainstream web browsers including, Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Safari without the use of a plugin.

COLOR NIGHT VISION – Built to weather any storm and the darkest of nights, this outdoor POE IP Bullet Camera features a heavy-duty metal weatherproof IP67 housing, built-in microphone for one-way audio, as well as color night vision up to 49 feet. Dual H.265/H.264 compression allows for maximum encryption with the latest technology as well as backward compatibility with legacy platforms. Works with Alexa through AmcrestCloud (AI features Not Supported with Alexa).

SECURE CLOUD VIDEO BACKUP – The optional Amcrest Cloud remote video storage subscription service allows you automatically store your videos off-site in a third-party location hosted and secured by Amazon AWS. This way if something happens to your local PC/NVR/NAS/MicroSD, the footage will be safely recorded in a secure off-site location and accessible to you through a web-based interface for PC (Chrome/Firefox/Safari/Edge) and AmcrestCloud smartphone app.

SIMPLE, RELIABLE, SECURE – This Amcrest AI IP POE camera features a secure SSL/HTTPS connection, FCC, and CE certificates and receives regular firmware updates. At Amcrest, we want to ensure the safety of our customers, their loved ones, homes and businesses. Supports storage to a MicroSD Card (up to 256GB), PC, or Amcrest Cloud. Compatible with the following Amcrest AI NVR's: B08CJJC9HN, B08KHQD5R8, B08KHQXL48, B08CJJ3YKR, B08KHD3QYJ, B08KHQZXCX

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Built-In Microphone Listen to what matters most using the built-in microphone for one-way audio. The camera is equipped with a heavy-duty IP67 weatherproof housing that protects against dust and hurricane level winds and rain. Mobile Viewing & Alerts View, record, and playback UltraHD footage directly from your smartphone with the Amcrest View Pro or Amcrest Cloud app. View up to 16 cameras at one time with Multi-View feature. Record UltraHD footage directly to a 256GB MicroSD card (sold separately). Never worry about losing your footage with Amcrest Cloud optional Cloud storage plans. Flexible Storage Record and store what you want, where you want with flexible storage options including 256GB MicroSD, Amcrest Cloud, Amcrest Surveillance Pro for PC and Mac, Amcrest NVRs, Synology & QNAP NAS, FTP, Blue Iris and more, giving you the flexibility and security you need. This product may contain components which are not NDAA compliant. Wide Viewing Angle Cover every angle with the built- in super-wide 129° viewing angle, allowing you to keep an eye on what matters most. Equipped with night vision up to 49 ft, the Amcrest AI 5MP UltraHD PoE Outdoor Security Camera is the perfect home security solution for you and your loved ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice and powerful outdoor camera
reviews.reviewText: The IP5M-B1276EB-AI is a nice outdoor camera. It has several nice features as specified on the Amcrest website including active deterrent which actives a built in LED light when something moves within a specified area. The camera has nice video during the day and night. The nighttime IR vision is great, but I was slightly unhappy with the nighttime color vision. However, if you set the light to come on with motion (night vision Smart Illumination) the video is very clear in color. I had to call support to figure out that you must have smart motion detection on in order for the night vision Smart Illumination to work. The support people were helpful with this and a few other small issues. The camera is not wireless, so I purchased an Amcrest POE to hook it up. There is an AC adapter plug if you prefer to purchase an AC adapter and not use POE. It was easy to set up and worked perfect. This camera is very powerful if you want to play with it but it works fine with the defaults out of the box.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars cutting edge survelliance camera
reviews.reviewText: The Amcrest 5MP IP PoE AI Camera is a game-changer in the world of outdoor security. This camera is a remarkable piece of technology that brings cutting-edge features to the table.Pros:Crystal Clear 5MP Video: The 5MP resolution delivers video quality that's incredibly sharp and detailed. You won't miss any crucial details, even in the darkest of situations.AI-Powered Human Detection: The AI features are a standout. This camera's ability to differentiate humans from other objects significantly reduces false alarms, which has been a flaw with previous cameras. It's a relief for anyone tired of being alerted for minor movements.Color Night Vision: The night vision capabilities are a game-changer. Unlike traditional infrared-only night vision, this camera provides full-color night vision. This means you can see vital details, like clothing colors and license plates, even in the dark.Sturdy Build: The camera is robust and built to endure the elements. It is resistant to harsh weather conditions, which is a must for outdoor cameras.Power over Ethernet (PoE): PoE simplifies installation. You don't need a separate power source; a single Ethernet cable handles both power and data.Amcrest Cloud Service: The cloud service offers convenient remote access to your camera's live feed and recordings from anywhere, providing peace of mind.Easy Setup: The included Amcrest surveillance software and mobile app make it simple to set up and manage the camera. Even those with limited tech skills can handle it.The Amcrest 5MP IP PoE AI Camera is a top-tier outdoor security solution. With its AI-powered human detection, stunning 5MP video, and remarkable color night vision, it's a significant upgrade for any security setup. It's not just about keeping an eye on your property; it's about having a robust and smart defense system in place. For anyone serious about security, this camera is a worthy investment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great low-cost nightvision camera, no subscription required
reviews.reviewText: You will need a PoE cable and switch to power this camera, or use a PoE injector. This is not a wireless camera.Installation is pretty straightforward, drill the mount holes and drill a hole through the center of the mount for the cables to route. The cables are hidden after installation. I have a small PoE switch, so only one ethernet cable was required for data and power. Hardware seems really solid, the housing is metal, waterproof, and feels like the camera should last a very long time.Night vision is really great for the price. Human and vehicle detection work really well. Video is smooth and good quality. The color nightvision works a lot better than I expected it to. The tripwire feature is really great.I use this with Home Assistant and offsite storage with sftp. No cloud subscription required. I love the flexible storage options and I'll keep buying Amcrest cameras as long as they offer flexible storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Premium Surveillance Camera with Great Performance and a Few Minor Flaws
reviews.reviewText: Let me say that I already have many Amcrest IP cameras and after testing several brands I settled on Amcrest. Their free surveillance software and build quality have kept me with them for many years.I recently had the chance to try out this camera, and overall, I was quite impressed with what it had to offer. From its well-protected packaging to its easy-to-find online instructions and high-quality build, this camera really exuded a premium feel right out of the box.One of the standout features of this camera was its picture and video quality, which was simply superb. The camera captured clear and detailed images, even in low light conditions, and the video was smooth and stable. I also appreciated the easy access memory door and the fact that it was rubber sealed with no fall-out screws, which made it simple to upgrade the camera's storage capacity without any fuss.Another great feature of this surveillance camera was its low power consumption, which is a real plus for anyone looking to save on energy costs. And the fact that it was compatible with the Surveillance Pro software was a huge bonus, as this is a top-of-the-line program that can really enhance the camera's functionality.That being said, there were a few areas where this camera fell short. For example, I wasn't a big fan of the fact that the memory door was located on the bottom of the camera, which made it easy for anyone to notice and potentially steal the memory card. Additionally, while the Surveillance Pro software was great overall, I did find that it had some trouble auto-finding the camera at installation.Finally, I was a bit disappointed that I had to change the bracket for an upgrade, as the new version required a 3-hole mount instead of the previous 4-hole design. This may not be a big deal for everyone, but it did require some additional work on my end that I wasn't expecting. I will probably make some sort of 3d printed adapter so I do not have to drill new holes when replacing additional cameras.Overall, I think this surveillance camera is a great option for anyone looking for high-end performance and build quality. While there are a few areas where it could use some improvement, these are relatively minor issues that don't detract from the camera's overall appeal.
